subject: Relationships
title: Reclaiming Your Identity
description: Learn Reclaiming Your Identity in one minute.

hook.text: 'What do you like?' After years of orbiting someone else's needs, the simplest question becomes the hardest.

buildup.text: Toxic relationships slowly erase personal identity. Survivors often can't name their own preferences, goals, or values.

discovery.text: Identity recovery starts small: choosing a meal, picking a song, saying no to something tiny. Autonomy rebuilds.

twist.text: The person you were before the relationship may not return. But the person you become after can be even stronger.

climax.text: Reclaiming your identity isn't going backward. It's building a new self from the wisdom the pain left behind.

punchline.text: After toxic love, rediscovering yourself is the greatest act of rebellion.

quiz.question: How does identity recovery after toxic relationships typically begin?
options: Small choices that rebuild autonomy gradually
